pullRequest.body:
This is extracted from the draft PR https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/4116 which tries to compare this definition with the definition in terms of a presheaf in `RingMod`.

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5843396570/job/15845511399)

Let's get this merged! The proof of the pudding... can't be established without the eating.

bors merge

This looks great! We have to start somewhere and I propose we start here.

Note that this is a (much much better,  but developed independently as far as I know) version of the experimental file https://github.com/ImperialCollegeLondon/tcc-lean-alg-geom-2022/blob/master/src/sheaves_of_modules/defs.lean which I successfully used to do some more very basic stuff in an 8 hour graduate course; I only cite this repo because it can be considered as evidence that the approach in this PR is viable.

This looks great! We have to start somewhere and I propose we start here.

Note that this is a (much much better,  but developed independently as far as I know) version of the experimental file https://github.com/ImperialCollegeLondon/tcc-lean-alg-geom-2022/blob/master/src/sheaves_of_modules/defs.lean which I successfully used to do some more very basic stuff in an 8 hour graduate course; I only cite this repo because it can be considered as evidence that the approach in this PR is viable.

Let's get this merged! The proof of the pudding... can't be established without the eating.

bors merge
Can this move happen now?

```suggestion
variable {C : Type u₁} [Category.{v₁} C]
```
Are we now in a post "declare universe v1 before u1" world or is this an oversight?

```suggestion
structure PresheafOfModules (R : Cᵒᵖ ⥤ RingCat.{u}) where
```
Why not call this R throughout? I think it would make the code easier to read. There's plenty of little `f`s, but `F` is a ring object.

Surely this is not a comment about sheaves of modules. The sheaf condition on a sheaf of modules is *by definition* the sheaf condition either at the level of abelian groups or at the level of types, so if this comment is supposed to mean "we can check that presheaves of of abelian groups are sheaves either by using groups or types" then this is a comment about sheaves of abelian groups, not about sheaves of modules.
Indeed, this was me blindly copy-pasting from an earlier draft about RingMod.

Other future work: presheaves of modules over a given sheaf of rings are an abelian category (do we need this, or should one stick to sheaves here?), tensor product of presheaves of modules over a given sheaf of rings (again do we want this? It's a random example to check that module theory can be globalised), presheaves are a monoidal category or whatever the right abstraction is, pushforward and pullback (perhaps the correct generality is that you're given some morphism of categories and a compatible morphism of the rings?),...
I propose `R` as a better choice throughout.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: presheaf of modules over a presheaf of rings
